incident_updates.body:
All systems are operational now. 

Between 1:00 a.m. and 2:00 a.m. (CET), we experienced a high load on our platform, which may have led to degraded performance and slowed down our services during that timeframe.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Performance has recovered, and we are investigating the root cause.
We're experiencing degraded performance on our API due to an increase in load on the API. We're investigating the problem.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

The automated QA system incorrectly flagged some Actors published in the Apify Store as "Under maintenance" due to a system error, causing a false positive test result. No issues were detected in the Actors' actual runtime behavior.

As a creator of these Actors, you can ignore the alerts. This only affected Actors published in the Apify Store.

incidents.name: Google SERP proxy has increased response times

incident_updates.body: We have implemented a fix, and the response time has been recovering since 09:30 UTC. As of 10:30 UTC, the response time has returned to normal. We will continue to monitor the response time. We apologize for any inconvenience caused.

Since 00:10 UTC, the Google SERP proxy has experienced increased response times. This may cause requests using the proxy to time out. As a temporary workaround, we recommend increasing the request timeout. We apologize for any inconvenience and are working toward a swift resolution.

The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

components.name: Console (console.apify.com)
components.description: Application running at console.apify.com

incident_updates.body:
Malfunctioning scheduler post-mortem

Date of incident: 2025-02-24  
Duration: 10:30 UTC - 16:15 UTC  
Impact: 

* From 10:30 UTC to 15:00 UTC, some of the schedules were triggered more than once. It started as a small-scale issue, and the problem escalated after 14:00 UTC.
* From 15:00 UTC to 15:55 UTC, API performance was degraded, and some Actor builds and runs were stuck in the READY state. Some Actor runs were aborted but can be resurrected.
* From 15:25 UTC to 16:15 UTC, schedules were not working, so some Actor runs did not start at all.

What happened?

* We implemented a change that would improve Actor startup performance by targeting Docker layers more effectively.
* The change caused certain database items to increase in size, overloading the network of the primary cluster and leading to degraded performance.
* Some core components, including those behind the scheduler, repeatedly went out of memory.

What we did

* We temporarily paused the Actor run scheduler and manually aborted runs triggered after 15:00 UTC.
* We downscaled the platform to make the database responsive again and reverted the change causing the bug.

Next steps

* We will improve our monitoring to catch similar problems, deviations, and network spikes sooner before they escalate.
* We will investigate the component's current architecture to ensure we prevent such incidents in the future. 

We apologize for the disruption and appreciate your patience. If you have any questions, please reach out to [support@apify.com](mailto:support@apify.com).

Sincerely,  
Apify engineering team

Summary: We experienced a partial outage of the scheduler and degraded performance of Apify API.

Timeframe: The issue started at a small scale from 11.00 UTC and then escalated around 15.00 UTC. By 16.15 UTC, the issue was resolved.

Impact:
 - During the incident, some scheduled Actors did not start or were run twice.
 - In response, we've aborted some of the runs that started after 15:00 UTC and turned off the Schedule component for approximately 45 minutes.
 - If your runs were aborted, they can now be safely resurrected; see: https://docs.apify.com/platform/actors/running/runs-and-builds#resurrection-of-finished-run
 - There was no data loss for runs in progress, but some runs were not triggered.
 - API performance was degraded at various levels along the incident, and some runs started via API may have been in a READY state for longer than usual.

We're sorry for the inconvenience. We take this issue seriously and will implement measures to mitigate similar issues in the future.
We will provide a post-mortem summary here with more details later this week.
We have identified the root cause and deployed a fix. Both API and Actor components are now stable, and we’re slowly starting the scheduled runs.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We're experiencing issues with scheduling. Some Actor runs may not start in time. We are identifying potentially started duplicate Actor runs. The first problems started around 11:00 CET at a very small scale and escalated around 3:00 UTC. 

The performance of API is partially degraded, and some endpoints might be answering slower than usual.

We're investigating the issue and will keep you informed about the progress. We are sorry for the inconvenience caused; this is a critical issue.

In response to the incident, we aborted some of the runs in the ready state. This affects runs that were started by the scheduler or another way from 2025-02-24 15:00 UTC. These runs can be resurrected if needed.

incident_updates.body:
Saturday outage post-mortem  
Date of incident: 2025-02-22

Impact: 

* Complete downtime of the Apify platform from 22.00 UTC to 23.00 UTC.
* No Actors could be started. 
* Those already running were paused and continued running after the incident was resolved. 
* There was no data loss, but the workloads were disrupted.

What happened:

* Our user base is growing fast, and the number of new signups is increasing exponentially. The exponentially increased load revealed suboptimalities that had not manifested before.
* One misconfigured query then caused a peak in memory due to a load of a suboptimal index, which caused the cluster to crash.

What we did:

* The cluster size was increased to ensure enough memory until the issue was fixed. 
* Then, the cluster and all the dependent systems were restarted.

Next steps:

* We are already re-architecting our primary database clusters to optimize systems for future growth.
* As part of this, we aim to decrease the size of all our clusters to ensure performant restarts in case of a problem.
* We are currently optimizing indexing and querying among heavy-load components.
* In addition, we identified missing metrics that would indicate similar problems ahead of time.

We sincerely apologize for the disruption and appreciate your patience. If you have any questions, please reach out to [support@apify.com](mailto:support@apify.com).

Sincerely,  
Apify engineering team
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

A fix has been implemented and we're monitoring the results. It might take some time to allocate all jobs, until all services have fully recovered.

We're sorry for the inconvenience. We will implement new measures based on this critical incident to prevent similar incidents in the future.
We've identified the cause of the issue and are taking steps to resolve it.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are investigating the issue.

incidents.name: False positive alert at status page

incident_updates.body: Due to an issue in Apify's status page automation, the false positive outage may have been reported here between 4:45 AM and 6:15 AM UTC. All systems were operational at that time.

The incident has been resolved. It was caused by a bug with database updates under high load.

Between 7:30 UTC and 8:10 UTC, the Apify platform was overloaded, and most operations were timing out or failing. This includes API calls, running Actors, proxy requests, or accessing the Console.

There has been no data loss. Scheduled Actors were executed with a delay once the platform recovered. The dates of last modifications of request queues might not be fully up-to-date.
A fix has been implemented and the platform is recovering. We will do an analysis of the impact and determine the appropriate remediation.
Due to an internal database issue, the whole platform is overloaded, and most requests are failing.

incidents.name: Small number of Actors unable to start

incident_updates.body:
Due to an internal misconfiguration, between October 15, 11:00 UTC and October 16, 6:30 UTC, a small number of Actors were unable to start, either when started via API, or when scheduled to run regularly. We have identified the issue and implemented a fix, and the Actors are now starting normally.

There was no data loss, and no excessive charges for the failed Actors.

We apologize for the inconvenience, and we will contact the affected users soon.
There was an increased error rate for amazon.com and facebook.com between 05:30 and 06:30 UTC.

We’ve experienced internal system issues between 18:20 UTC and 21:30 UTC. The underlying issue has been addressed and we’ll be contacting the impacted users over next week.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Not all the domains were affected by the incident.

incidents.name: Degraded performance of some integrations (Gmail, Gdrive, Asana, Trello, GitHub)

incident_updates.body:
The reliability of the listed integrations is now close to normal.
Some invocations occasionally need to be retried to get a successful response.

One of our integration partners has been experiencing degraded stability of their integrations:
- Gmail
- Gdrive
- Asana
- Trello
- GitHub

Some invocations have not been fired. We work with our partner on resolving the issue and ensuring it won't happen again.

incidents.name: Degraded performance of some integrations (Gmail, Gdrive, Asana, Trello, GitHub)

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

One of our integration partners has been experiencing degraded stability of their integrations for the past few hours:
- Gmail
- Gdrive
- Asana
- Trello
- GitHub

Some invocations have not been fired. Everything is recovered at this point. We work with our partner to ensure that this won't happen again, as this is a critical functionality.

The original root cause was discovered. We identified the root cause as a database cluster issue and implemented a successful recovery yesterday. Our systems are now stable and functioning optimally. 

Impact:

As a result of this issue, some users of pay-per-result Actors were charged more than they should have paid if the run was running during one of the following intervals:
- 2024/07/03 15-17 UTC
- 2024/07/04 04-06 UTC

We are currently investigating the full scope of this issue and will issue refunds to affected users within the next week. Based on our initial assessment, the number of impacted users is limited.

Future Prevention:

Over the coming week, our team will prioritize implementing more measures to prevent similar incidents in the future. We consider this issue a high-severity matter and are committed to ensuring the continued reliability of our services.

We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this caused.
A long-term fix was deployed to the production environment to mitigate another performance drop. We will keep monitoring the system.

We have identified the cause of the issue and implemented a workaround. A proper fix will be deployed later today.

There was no data loss, however the performance of Actors and API operations was degraded between 4 AM and 6 AM UTC 2024-07-04, and some scheduled Actors and tasks might have been triggered twice.
The incident reappeared. Although the previous fix lessened the impact, we're still facing degraded performance of Actor runs and builds.
A fix has been implemented and we will keep monitoring the results.
The system is operating normally at this point. We are still investigating the issue and will be implementing new measures.
The performance of Actor runs and builds is degraded. We are experiencing a slowdown in our internal systems and are investigating the issue.

components.name: Actors
components.description: Actors are serverless cloud programs running on Apify that can perform arbitrary computing jobs, such as send an email or crawl a website with millions of pages.

incidents.name: Console UI temporarily unavailable for some users

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are monitoring the situation.

We are experiencing temporary issues with the loading of Console UI due to DNS changes.
These issues should be automatically resolved in a few minutes.

components.name: Console (console.apify.com)
components.description: Application running at console.apify.com

incidents.name: Code editor in Apify Console is not loading

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have switched to a different CDN and the code editor is working again.
The code editor in Apify Console is not loading due to an issue with CDN. We are now in the process of a switch to a different CDN.

components.name: Console (console.apify.com)
components.description: Application running at console.apify.com

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

All the workloads have recovered. There was no data loss, but Actors were disrupted at different levels from about 16:00 UTC up until 18:00 UTC.

The problem was caused by the resolution of internal DNS records. We are currently monitoring the situation and releasing changes to beware of this in the future. 

We are sorry for all the inconvenience caused. Reliability is our priority, and we will be implementing more changes to prevent such situations in the future.
Actor runtime has a complete outage. The actors are not running. There is no data loss. We are working on discovering the root cause.
API services might be running slow or experiencing intermittent outages. We are currently investigating the issue.

incident_updates.body: API servers were running slow or experiencing intermittent outages between 12:19 pm UTC and 12:34 UTC. All systems are operational, and we apologize for any inconvenience this might have caused.

incidents.name: Some background operations might be delayed

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Operations like publishing Actors, sending notifications, or adding new organization members might be delayed.
We have identified the cause and are preparing a fix.

components.name: Console (console.apify.com)
components.description: Application running at console.apify.com

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. There was no data loss as requests are being retried, but some of the Actor runs may have failed. You can resurrect the failed runs (https://docs.apify.com/platform/actors/running/runs-and-builds#resurrection-of-finished-run) to continue running.
While the proxy was the main affected component, the problem was related to our IAM service and other components like API, Actors or webhooks were affected as well.

We have experienced an outage of the service managing IAM from 12:50 to 13:00 UTC. This was due to a misconfiguration while releasing a new version. We have reverted the release and everything is operational again.

components.name: Datacenter
components.description: Datacenter IP addresses that are shared with other users. They represent the most cost-effective option for many target websites, although there is a chance the IPs might be blocked due to activity of other users.

components.name: Webhooks
components.description: Webhooks provide an easy and reliable way to configure the Apify platform to carry out an action when a certain system event occurs. For example, you can use webhooks to start another actor when an actor run finishes or fails.

incidents.name: API performance degraded and outage of Actors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have experienced two restarts of our servers that run Actors. It was caused by performance degradation of our API. There was no data loss. Some Actors may have failed and you can resurrect them to make them work again. We isolated the root cause and we're implementing measures to prevent this from happening in the future.
We are currently investigating degraded API performance and outage of Actors
We are currently investigating degraded API performance

components.name: API (api.apify.com)
components.description: Back-end services running at https://api.apify.com

components.name: Actors
components.description: Actors are serverless cloud programs running on Apify that can perform arbitrary computing jobs, such as send an email or crawl a website with millions of pages.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue was resolved, and only a single customer was affected. We are monitoring the situation.
We are experiencing a degraded performance of Apify API and are investigating the root cause. Only the performance (response time) is impacted, with no impact on data quality or anything else.

components.name: API (api.apify.com)
components.description: Back-end services running at https://api.apify.com

incidents.name: Actor builds might fail and the overall performance might be degraded

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The health of upstream dependencies has been resolved and we are in turn no longer experiencing degraded performance.

AWS is currently experiencing degraded performance and a higher error rate (https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status). This has a cascading effect on different external systems, such as DockerHub, affecting in turn us as well. Most notably, we're experiencing a higher error rate on Actor builds. We will continue to monitor the health of upstream services and of our platform to mitigate any potential issues.

incidents.name: Degraded stability of static proxy groups

incident_updates.body:
We experienced a short incident during which the stability of Apify's static proxy groups (StaticUS1 and StaticUS3) was degraded. Default data center proxy groups were not affected by this incident. 

Problems were resolved in about 30 minutes. We are monitoring the situation to make sure that the situation is permanently resolved.

incidents.name: Increased error rate and latency across all services

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The problem was fixed on the AWS cloud side. Everything is back to a normal state, and elevated error rates are resolved. 

The whole Apify platform stayed operational throughout the incident, but the elevated error rates of our API caused a performance drop. This may have caused some Actor runs to fail. In such cases, you can resurrect them (https://docs.apify.com/platform/actors/running/runs-and-builds#resurrection-of-finished-run), and the runs will continue from the point of failure.
As the cloud provider has issues with identity access management, the error rate of all operations is higher than usual, resulting in Actors' degraded performance.
Due to an issue at our cloud service provider, most of our services are experiencing increased error rates and latencies. We are investigating the issue and will attempt to mitigate the impact.

components.name: Dataset
components.description: Store results from your web scraping, crawling or data processing jobs into Apify datasets and then export it to various formats like JSON, CSV, XML, RSS, Excel or HTML.

components.name: Request queue
components.description: Maintain a queue of URLs of web pages in order to recursively crawl websites, starting from initial URLs and adding new links as they are found while skipping duplicates.

incidents.name: Platform is fully operational, status page is down

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are only experiencing problems with the Status Page itself, so everything is displayed as down. But the Apify platform including all the components is fully operational.
This incident has been resolved.

Apify Residential Proxy service is down for many different countries. Problems started at about 9:45 UTC and are caused by one of our providers, traffic is being re-routed alternatively way and the service should recover in a couple of minutes.
